solution: Define adult bear in Jefferson Circus as x; so x = 3. Define average number of newborn children per adult fox in Jefferson Circus as S; so S = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult bear in Jefferson Circus as R; so R = x = 3. Define adult fox in Jefferson Circus as G; so G = S = 4. Define total number of newborn animal children in Jefferson Circus as A; X = x * R = 3 * 3 = 9; I = G * S = 4 * 4 = 16; A = X + I = 9 + 16 = 25. Define adult bear in Mayer Aquarium as P; so P = A - S = 25 - 4 = 21. Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Bundle Ranch as F; so F = P + S = 21 + 4 = 25. Define adult wolf in Bundle Ranch as s; so s = 4. Define total number of newborn animal children in Bundle Ranch as c; so c = s * F = 4 * 25 = 100. Define average number of newborn children per adult fox in Mayer Aquarium as D; q = c = 100; so D = 4 * q = 4 * 100 = 400. Answer: 400.

Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in Mayer Aquarium as r; P = W = 4; so r = 4 * P = 4 * 4 = 16. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Mayer Aquarium as B; M = W = 4; so B = 4 + M = 4 + 4 = 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Mayer Aquarium as G; so G = 1. Define adult parrot in Mayer Aquarium as E; f = W = 4; so E = 2 + f = 2 + 4 = 6. Define adult eagle in Mayer Aquarium as t; so t = 2. Define adult owl in Mayer Aquarium as q; so q = B = 8. Define total number of newborn animal children in Mayer Aquarium as J; Z = E * B = 6 * 8 = 48; n = q * r = 8 * 16 = 128; l = t * G = 2 * 1 = 2; m = Z + n = 48 + 128 = 176; J = m + l = 176 + 2 = 178. Answer: 178.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Bundle Ranch as G; so G = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Jefferson Circus as N; P = A = 16; so N = 4 * P = (4) * (16) = 64. Define adult parrot in Jefferson Circus as t; so t = G = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Jefferson Circus as O; so O = N = 64. Define adult crow in Jefferson Circus as z; so z = 2. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Jefferson Circus as w; e = N = 64; so w = 2 + e = 2 + 64 = 66. Define adult blue jay in Jefferson Circus as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of newborn animal children in Jefferson Circus as T; Y = z * w = (2) * (66) = 132; B = x * N = (x) * (64) = 64*x; D = t * O = (4) * (64) = 256; E = Y + B = 132 + 64*x = 64*x + 132; T = E + D = 64*x + 132 + 256 = 64*x + 388. We know T = 644, so we have 64*x + 388 = 644 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 64*x + 388 = 644. Move all terms to one side: 64*x - 256 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 64*x = 256. Divide both sides by 64: x = 256 / 64. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.

We know T = 29, so we have 5*x + 24 = 29 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 5*x + 24 = 29. Move all terms to one side: 5*x - 5 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 5*x = 5. Divide both sides by 5: x = 5 / 5. Solution: x = 1. Answer: 1.

Define total number of teachers from all schools in Riverton City as V; U = Y * D = (2) * (3) = 6; m = x * M = (x) * (8) = 8*x; l = Z * z = (3*x) * (3) = 9*x; c = U + m = 6 + 8*x = 8*x + 6; V = c + l = 8*x + 6 + 9*x = 17*x + 6. We know V = 40, so we have 17*x + 6 = 40 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 17*x + 6 = 40. Move all terms to one side: 17*x - 34 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 17*x = 34. Divide both sides by 17: x = 34 / 17. Solution: x = 2. Answer: 2.

Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Hawkesbury as b; F = e - N = (16) - (2) = 14; so b = 4 + F = 4 + 14 = 18. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Hawkesbury as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define culinarian school in Hawkesbury as t; so t = N = 2. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Hawkesbury as s; h = Z * x = (36) * (x) = 36*x; J = t * b = (2) * (18) = 36; s = h + J = 36*x + 36 = 36*x + 36. We know s = 108, so we have 36*x + 36 = 108 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 36*x + 36 = 108. Move all terms to one side: 36*x - 72 = 0.
